title: Towns and Cities
summary: Vocabulary for describing towns and cities, including common buildings and places, and adjectives used to characterize urban areas.

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: In this pre-intermediate vocabulary lesson about Towns and Cities, you will learn essential adjectives used to describe towns or cities and different nouns for common places you can find in them. The pictures, descriptions, and examples below will help you understand and remember the terms.

sections.heading: Common buildings and places
sections.content: Vocabulary for different locations found in towns and cities.

examples.example: An area with trees and grass that is open to the public.
A place that is open to the public where you can go and borrow books.
A building where historical objects are exhibited.
An open place or building with different stands that sell vegetables, meat, fish, food, and other things.
A large building or area with many different shops, restaurants, etc.
A building where you can buy stamps and send letters.
A building that is used by the local government.
A religious building where Christians go to pray.
A religious building where Muslims go to pray.
A large building with high walls used to protect people from attack.
An image of a person or animal that is made of stone or other materials.
Something like a monument, famous building, or museum that tourists like to see when they visit a town or city.
A residential area on the edge of a city.
A large building or group of buildings where machines are used to make goods, e.g., cars, toys, boxes, etc.
An area where people can leave their cars.
I like to do my shopping downtown. I live in the suburbs but I work downtown. I have an office in downtown Los Angeles.

sections.heading: Adjectives for describing towns and cities
sections.content: Words used to characterize urban areas.

examples.example: The shopping centre is a busy place, especially on a Saturday. The centre of London is always crowded.
Soho is a vibrant area with lots of popular bars.
The park is a peaceful place where I often go to relax.
All the buildings in the city are very modern.
The city centre is full of historical buildings.
It's a multicultural area, home to residents of many different nationalities.
My city is a safe place to live, which is one of the reasons I enjoy living there.
It's quite a dangerous area, so I would avoid it if you can.
Our hotel was in a touristy area, minutes away from museums and tourist attractions.
It's a beautiful part of town with lots of picturesque buildings and shops.
It's an industrial area, home to many car factories.
She's just bought a house in a quiet residential area.
